thyroid cancer.context: The patient had thyroid cancer, papillary cell type, removed with a total thyroidectomy and then subsequently recurrent disease was removed with a paratracheal dissection.

papillary cell type.context: The patient had thyroid cancer, papillary cell type, removed with a total thyroidectomy and then subsequently recurrent disease was removed with a paratracheal dissection.

total thyroidectomy.context: The patient had thyroid cancer, papillary cell type, removed with a total thyroidectomy and then subsequently recurrent disease was removed with a paratracheal dissection.

paratracheal dissection.context: The patient had thyroid cancer, papillary cell type, removed with a total thyroidectomy and then subsequently recurrent disease was removed with a paratracheal dissection.

metastatic papillary cancer.context: Preoperative Diagnosis: Metastatic papillary cancer, left neck.

lesion in the left mid neck.context: He now has evidence of lesion in the left mid neck and the left superior neck on ultrasound, which are suspicious for recurrent cancer.

lesion in the left superior neck.context: He now has evidence of lesion in the left mid neck and the left superior neck on ultrasound, which are suspicious for recurrent cancer.

ultrasound.context: He now has evidence of lesion in the left mid neck and the left superior neck on ultrasound, which are suspicious for recurrent cancer.

recurrent cancer.context: He now has evidence of lesion in the left mid neck and the left superior neck on ultrasound, which are suspicious for recurrent cancer.

shoulder roll.context: The patient was placed on the operating room table in the supine position. After adequate general endotracheal anesthesia was administered, the table was then turned. A shoulder roll placed under the shoulders and the face was placed in an extended fashion.

Betadine.context: The left neck, chest, and face were prepped with Betadine and draped in a sterile fashion.

hockey stick skin incision.context: A hockey stick skin incision was performed, extending a previous incision line superiorly towards the mastoid cortex through skin, subcutaneous tissue and platysma with Bovie electrocautery on cut mode.

Bovie electrocautery.context: A hockey stick skin incision was performed, extending a previous incision line superiorly towards the mastoid cortex through skin, subcutaneous tissue and platysma with Bovie electrocautery on cut mode.

subplatysmal superior and inferior flaps.context: Subplatysmal superior and inferior flaps were raised.

dissection was left lateral neck dissect.context: The dissection was left lateral neck dissection encompassing zones 1, 2A, 2B, 3, and the superior portion of 4.

sternocleidomastoid muscle.context: The sternocleidomastoid muscle was unwrapped at its fascial attachment and this was taken back posterior to the XI cranial nerve into the superior posterior most triangle of the neck.

XI cranial nerve.context: The X, XI, and XII cranial nerves were preserved.

splenius capitis.context: The dissection was carried forward off of the deep rooted muscles including the splenius capitis and anterior and middle scalenes taken medially off of these muscles including the fascia of the muscles, stripped from the carotid artery, the X cranial nerve, the internal jugular vein and then carried anteriorly to the lateral most extent of the dissection previously done by Dr. X in the paratracheal region.

anterior and middle scalenes.context: The dissection was carried forward off of the deep rooted muscles including the splenius capitis and anterior and middle scalenes taken medially off of these muscles including the fascia of the muscles, stripped from the carotid artery, the X cranial nerve, the internal jugular vein and then carried anteriorly to the lateral most extent of the dissection previously done by Dr. X in the paratracheal region.

carotid artery.context: The internal jugular vein and carotid artery were preserved as well.

X cranial nerve.context: The dissection was carried forward off of the deep rooted muscles including the splenius capitis and anterior and middle scalenes taken medially off of these muscles including the fascia of the muscles, stripped from the carotid artery, the X cranial nerve, the internal jugular vein and then carried anteriorly to the lateral most extent of the dissection previously done by Dr. X in the paratracheal region.

internal jugular vein.context: The internal jugular vein and carotid artery were preserved as well.

Q cranial nerve.context: The X, XI, and XII cranial nerves were preserved.

XII cranial nerve.context: The X, XI, and XII cranial nerves were preserved.

positive nodes.context: There were two obviously positive nodes in this neck dissection.

Blake drain.context: A #10 flat fluted Blake drain was placed through a separate stab incision and it was secured to the skin with a 2-0 silk ligature.

silk ligature.context: A #10 flat fluted Blake drain was placed through a separate stab incision and it was secured to the skin with a 2-0 silk ligature.

Vicryl.context: The wound was closed in layers using a 3-0 Vicryl in a buried knot interrupted fashion for the subcutaneous tissue and the skin was closed with staples.

staples.context: The wound was closed in layers using a 3-0 Vicryl in a buried knot interrupted fashion for the subcutaneous tissue and the skin was closed with staples.

fluff and Kling pressure dressing.context: A fluff and Kling pressure dressing was then applied.
